Pochettino hyller Everton-kapteinens gest etter skrekkskaden
Séamus Coleman kom inn i Tottenham-garderoben for å trøste Son Heung-min.
04 Nov 2019, 08:22 by Bernhard Veland
78 minutter ut i Premier League-oppgjøret på Goodison Park, på stillingen 0–1, forsøkte Tottenhams Son Heung-min å stoppe Evertons André Gomes ute ved sidelinjen.
Sørkoreaneren skled inn bakfra og sendte Gomes bortover gressmatten, der han kolliderte med Tottenhams Serge Aurier.
I kollisjonen ble Gomes’ høyre fot fanget mellom ballen og Auriers bein, og ankelen ble vridd i en helt unaturlig stilling.
Gomes ble liggende med store smerter, mens både med- og motspillere i umiddelbar nærhet snudde seg bort i avsky da de så Everton-spillerens høyre ben.

Sterke scener i Premier League – Tottenham-stjerne gikk gråtende av banen

Lenge ute
Nå melder Everton at det dreier seg om et brudd og en vridning i høyre ankel for Gomes. Spilleren skal opereres i løpet av dagen. Han må belage seg på en lang periode uten fotball.
Son brøt sammen i gråt og måtte hjelpes ut på sidelinjen. Han fikk rødt kort etter taklingen.
Sons lagkamerat Dele Alli forteller at Son satt utrøstelig i garderoben etter kampen.
– Han er knust og i tårer, men det er ikke hans skyld. Han er en av de snilleste menneskene jeg vet om, og han ville aldri ønsket det der, sier Alli i et intervju vist på TV 2.
Beslutningen om å gi Son rødt kort i situasjonen var omdiskutert, og ingen har til nå uttalt at utfallet av taklingen er noe annet enn et uhell.
Kaptein-trøst
Etter kampen kom Everton-kaptein Séamus Coleman inn i Tottenhams garderobe for å trøste Son Heung-min. Irland-spilleren opplevde selv en stygg bruddskade i en landskamp mot Wales i 2017.
– Everton-spillerne var fantastiske, og jeg vil gjerne takke, sier Tottenham-manager Mauricio Pochettino, ifølge Independent.
– Kapteinen, Coleman, kom innom garderoben for å trøste Sonny (Son). Nå som ting har roet seg, ønsker jeg å si «takk» til spillerne og selvsagt Coleman, som snakket på vegne av Everton-spillerne.
Pochettino er klar i sin oppfatning om at skaden var uheldig.
– Vi synes veldig synd på Andre, men slik er fotballen. Dette er en av konsekvensene. Sonny prøvde bare å rekke ballen, sier argentineren.
Everton-spillerne var veldig preget av det som skjedde.
Cenk Tosun er blant dem som har uttrykt sin støtte til lagkameraten.
– Jeg skulle ønske at jeg ikke hadde scoret, jeg skulle ønske at vi tapte 0–5 og at dette ikke skjedde. Jeg vet at du kommer tilbake sterkere, skriver han i et innlegg på Instagram.
text:
Pochettino paid tribute to the Everton captain's gesture after the scare injury
Séamus Coleman entered Tottenham wardrobe to comfort Son Heung-min.
04 Nov 2019, 08:22 by Bernhard Veland
78 minutes into the Premier League settlement at Goodison Park, in the score 0-1, Tottenham's Son Heung-min tried to stop Everton's André Gomes out at the sidelines.
The South Korean slid in from behind and sent Gomes over the grass mat, clashing with Tottenham's Serge Aurier.
In the collision, Gomes' right foot was caught between the ball and Aurier's leg, and his ankle was twisted in a completely unnatural position.
Gomes was left in great pain, while both fellows and opponents in the immediate vicinity turned away in disgust as they saw the Everton player's right leg.

Strong Premier League scenes - Tottenham star wept off the pitch

For a long time
Now Everton reports that it is a fracture and a twist in the right ankle for Gomes. The player should be operated during the day. He has to settle for a long period without football.
Son broke down in tears and had to be helped out on the sidelines. He got red shortly after the tackle.
Son's teammate Dele Alli says that Son sat inconsolably in the wardrobe after the match.
- He's crushed and in tears, but it's not his fault. He is one of the kindest people I know of, and he would never have wanted it there, Alli says in an interview shown on TV 2.
The decision to give Son a red card in the situation was debated, and no one has so far stated that the outcome of the tackle is anything but an accident.
Captain-consolation
After the match, Everton captain Séamus Coleman entered Tottenham's wardrobe to comfort Son Heung-min. The Ireland player himself suffered a foul injury in a 2017 international match against Wales.
"The Everton players were fantastic and I would like to thank them," Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino said, according to Independent.
- The captain, Coleman, came to the wardrobe to comfort Sonny (Son). Now that things have calmed down, I want to say "thank you" to the players and of course Coleman, who spoke on behalf of the Everton players.
Pochettino is clear in his view that the injury was unfortunate.
- We feel very sorry for Andre, but so is football. This is one of the consequences. Sonny was just trying to hit the ball, the Argentine says.
The Everton players were very much affected by what happened.
Cenk Tosun is among those who have expressed their support for the teammate.
- I wish I hadn't scored, I wish we had lost 0-5 and that this didn't happen. I know you're coming back stronger, he writes in a post on Instagram.
